title.narrative: F.a: Promoting Trade Union Inclusive Migration Governance

description.narrative: During the project phase a multi-stakeholder framework consisting of trade unions, ministries, protector of emigrants, employers and recruiting agencies, will be formed, and BWI?s aim is to develop policies and laws regulating work related migration. Trade unions will receive training on advocacy and lobby, and they will ensure pro-worker migrant policies. Bilateral country agreements that regulate migrant work will be reviewed and improved. Multi-stakeholder working group will meet to form positions to lob by for decision-makers.The second main area will be to recruit more migrant workers into trade union fold. This work through pre-departure trainings will also mean sensitizing masses on basic trade union rights, and in encountering grievance situations in constructive way. The project will conduct a study on current salary practices.Migration for work is constantly growing, and BWI?s aim is to make it safe and protected. Unethically operating recruitment agencies are pushed to transform themselves ethical a nd legal. Also norms that regulate migration are reviewed and developed.The project will start with various trainings. The multi-stakeholder working group will be formed and tasked to review and develop norms that regulate work based migration. Particularl y, the norms that regulate the recruitment agencies work will be put under rigorous review, so that the unethically operating agencies can be held responsible. Within the project timespan at least one agency will be challenged. Under the second objective, unions will contact tens of thousands of workers who aim to migrant work through pre-departure trainings. Leadership training among the migrant workers will develop 30 leaders, and will also train a pool of trainers to ensure leverage. Recruitment campaign s will result to 10 500 new trade union members.Particularly the new workers, who aim on migrant work, will benefit from this project. Also BWI and its eight affiliates will benefit from the project through the trainings and growing membership.The project will be implemented by BWI and its eight affiliates, of which two are from Nepal and six in India. BWI hold a long experience from constructions sector migrant work in Nepal and India.
